pull.title: refactor: [p2p] Make ProcessMessage private again, Use references when non-null
pull.body:
There is a single unit test, which calls the internal `ProcessMessage` function. This is problematic, because it makes future changes harder, since they will need to carry over this public internal interface each time.

Also, there is a mixed use of pointers and references in p2p code, where just based on context, a pointer may sometimes assumed to be null, or non-null. This is confusing when reading the code, or making or reading future changes.

Fix both issues in a series of commits, to:

* refactor the single unit test to call higher-level functions
* Make `ProcessMessage` private again
* Use references instead of implicit non-null pointers, mostly in a scripted-diff

rename.from: refactor: [p2p] Make ProcessMessage private again, Use references when non-null
rename.to: refactor: [p2p] Make ProcessMessage private again, Use references when non-null

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34181. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | Stale ACK | [bensig](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34181#issuecomment-3707426996), [optout21](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34181#issuecomment-3728995294) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#34389](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34389) (net/log: standardize peer+addr log formatting via `LogPeer` by l0rinc) * [#34293](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34293) (Bugfix: net_processing: Restore missing comma between peer and peeraddr in "receive version message" and "New ___ peer connected" by luke-jr) * [#34267](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34267) (net: avoid unconditional `privatebroadcast` logging (+ warn for debug logs) by l0rinc) * [#33854](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33854) (fix assumevalid is ignored during reindex by Eunovo) * [#32430](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32430) (test: Add and use ElapseTime helper by maflcko) * [#32278](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32278) (doc: better document NetEventsInterface and the deletion of "CNode"s by vasild) * [#27052](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27052) (test: rpc: add last block announcement time to getpeerinfo result by LarryRuane) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

ACK fa4dbf1b299dd7bf0fa4b0d5f713d5a393215cdc

Build and tests pass (denialofservice_tests, p2p_ping.py).

Clean refactor - using references instead of implicit non-null pointers makes the code clearer... and of course, ProcessMessage is private again.

reACK fa1f90938e1a99139e00731ae1edf29e2c3635a9
Re-review following rebase.

Prev:
reACK faba163fc38085d9d25b4b6df1d8c3abe4663aeb
utACK fa4dbf1b299dd7bf0fa4b0d5f713d5a393215cdc
The single external usage of a method is removed by changing a test, the method is changed to private. Some additional limited-scope refactors.
- code reviewed
- verified the diff script to produce the same result
- checked unit tests locally

author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1765814668 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1769523206 +0100

test: [refactor] Avoid calling private ProcessMessage() function

Calling this low-level function from tests is confusing, and also makes
it harder to change the peer manager implementation.

So juse use the pre-existing test helpers to achieve the same.

refactor: Separate peer/maybe_peer in ProcessMessages and SendMessages

Introducing two names to refer to the peer makes it possible to have one
refer to a non-null reference in a later commit.
